evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew is resistant to defeaters, as alternative causes do not sufficiently account for the observed coordination failures in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with the key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase, including miscommunication and lack of coordination.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observed and documented in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identification of procedural deviation in pushback execution for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim is robust against potential defeaters, ensuring reliable recognition despite possible confounding factors.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim dataset, reflecting typical patterns of deviation in this context.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase on 12-25.

assumptions: The continued movement beyond the TRP and collision with the barrier is attributable to communication/coordination breakdown among crew
No overriding mechanical or environmental causes are present
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination preventing the aircraft from passing the TRP or hitting the barrier
If mechanical failure or environmental factors were primary causes rather than communication breakdown

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H4 shows communication among crew and tug operators, a decision to stop pushback, seat swapping, and continued pushback leading to the aircraft passing the TRP and hitting a barrier, indicating observable communication/coordination breakdown supporting the claim.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in whether the continued movement beyond TRP was due to communication failure or procedural deviation

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with the key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase, including miscommunication and lack of coordination.

assumptions: The described interactions and behaviors reflect communication and coordination breakdown as key features.
No significant mechanical or environmental factors override the communication breakdown explanation.
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination without miscommunication or continuation beyond stop points, or if mechanical or environmental factors were primary causes.

node.statement: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew is resistant to defeaters, as alternative causes do not sufficiently account for the observed coordination failures in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency is present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim inspection on 12-25.

Evidence indicating no environmental or marking issues during the inspection

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim dataset, reflecting typical patterns of deviation in this context.

assumptions: The TRP ground markings were adequate and visible, so the deviation is procedural rather than environmental.
No mechanical control failure contributed to the pushback deviation.
defeaters: If evidence showed environmental factors like inadequate or unclear ground markings caused the deviation, or if mechanical failure was documented, this would change the assessment.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 directly describes the procedural deviation in pushback execution consistent with key features of the dataset, showing the aircraft moved beyond the TRP marking, supporting the claim. H1-H3 provide context of crew roles and actions but do not contradict this. The discriminator disc:R1_PUSHBACK_PROCEDURAL_DEVIATION|R3_ENVIRONMENT_OR_MARKING_DEFICIENCY favors procedural deviation over environmental deficiency.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit evidence about environmental marking adequacy or mechanical faults is provided, so some ambiguity remains.

node.statement: The identification of procedural deviation in pushback execution for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim is robust against potential defeaters, ensuring reliable recognition despite possible confounding factors.

assumptions: No mechanical control failure evidence exists beyond the provided history.
The described crew communications and actions are accurate and complete.
defeaters: If evidence of equipment fault traces or bench checks indicating mechanical control failure were found, it would challenge the procedural deviation identification.
If communication breakdown or environmental deficiencies were shown to better explain the event, the robustness claim would weaken.

The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence (H1-H4) shows clear procedural actions and decisions by the tug drivers and communication with the flight crew, supporting that the procedural deviation identification is robust and distinguishable from mechanical control failure as per the discriminator 'Equipment fault traces or bench checks separate control malfunction from operator procedural deviation.'
